meanings.definition: A decisive or overwhelming defeat or victory in a competition or argument.
meanings.sent1: The team experienced a smackdown in the championship game.
meanings.sent2: The wrestler delivered a powerful smackdown to his opponent.
meanings.sent3: The debate ended with a smackdown that left everyone speechless.
meanings.sent4: Her presentation was a verbal smackdown that silenced all opposition.
meanings.sent5: The final exam was a mental smackdown for the students.

meanings.definition: To forcefully put an end to something or someone.
meanings.sent1: The authorities had to smackdown the illegal activities in the area.
meanings.sent2: She decided to smackdown any negativity in her life.
meanings.sent3: He had to smackdown his fear of public speaking before the big presentation.
meanings.sent4: The superhero swooped in to smackdown the villain's evil plans.
meanings.sent5: The coach had to smackdown the rumors spreading among the team.
